Description: A glazed composition figure of a squatting baboon: with a fairly large well-formed face, including details of the eyes and brow-ridges. The mouth is indicated by an incised line. All the legs are delineated, the forepaws resting on the lower part of the bent hind legs. The figure is covered with a pale green glaze, some areas of which have turned white.
Curator's comments: For similar figures, see W. M. F. Petrie, 'Abydos' I (London, 1902), pl.LIII, 7-8; W. M. F. Petrie, 'Abydos' II (London, 1902-4), pls.VI, 50-61, 64, 65; IX, 202; X, 218-9; XI, 233. 235, 238, 247-8; J. E. Quibell & F. W. Green, 'Hierakonpolis' I (London, 1989), pl.XXII, 2, 11-12; B. Adams, 'Ancient Hierakonpolis' (Warminster, 1974), 24-9, nos. 123, 124, 127-37, 140. 142, T44: A. Scharff, ‘Die Altertümer der Vor – und Frühzeit Ägyptens’ II (Berlin, 1929-31), nos. 91-3 and pl.17; J. Capart, ‘Les Débuts de L’Art en Égypte’, 179-81; H. W. Müller, 'Ägyptische Kunstwerke, Kleinfunde und Glas in der Sammlung E. & M. Kofler-Truniger' (Berlin, 1964), A 13 a-o; G. Dreyer, 'Mitteilungen der Deutschen Archäologischen Instituts Abteilung Kairo' 32 (Wiesbaden, 1976), 85, in (a-b) and pl.24a-b. Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Abydos' I (London, 1902), pl. LIII, 9.
